Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Documentation block on the package info page doesn't display markdown correctly until you click "show more"" (#4784) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The gallery's rendering of the short version of the "documentation" block and the expanded section are not the same. The short version does not render markdown correctly. Clicking the "show more" link expands the block and renders the markdown correctly.

# Repro
1. Edit a package. E.g. https://www.nuget.org/packages/Yarn.MSBuild/1.0.1/Edit
1. Add this URL to the "Import Readme" => "URL" box: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/natemcmaster/Yarn.MSBuild/v1.0.1/README.md. This file contains this section

# Expected result

The "Documentation" section of https://www.nuget.org/packages/Yarn.MSBuild/1.0.1 shows the first paragraph or two from my README file

# Actual result

See https://www.nuget.org/packages/Yarn.MSBuild/1.0.1

The page shows what is normally "invisible" markdown, aka, markdown links. 

## Before clicking "Show more"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2696087/31050784-a6b3a9bc-a60a-11e7-8eaa-59985c6e1667.png)

## After 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2696087/31050787-c5f8f1a6-a60a-11e7-9bd9-130bd8a8106d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "< and > from imported markdown files display as < and >" (#4783) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The gallery does not display angle brackets in code blocks correctly in the package's documentation section comes from importing a markdown README file.

# Repro
1. Edit a package. E.g. https://www.nuget.org/packages/Yarn.MSBuild/1.0.1/Edit
1. Add this URL to the "Import Readme" => "URL" box: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/natemcmaster/Yarn.MSBuild/v1.0.1/README.md. This file contains this section
````md
**Package Manager Console in Visual Studio**
```
PM> Install-Package Yarn.MSBuild
```
````

# Expected result

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2696087/31050746-5801a22a-a609-11e7-9d56-9b9b32c4a37c.png)

# Actual result
It displays brackets as `>` and `<`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2696087/31050743-4536ea92-a609-11e7-8234-9b7d7ab6ca8e.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Latest Version on Manage Packages does not show SemVer 2.0.0 packages" (#4782) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Latest Version on Manage Packages does not show SemVer 2.0.0 packages in some scenarios.

In the below example all packages have SemVer 2.0.0 stable versions. Only SleetLib shows the correct version, Sleet for example should be 2.0.0.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6381138/31039229-e7580a24-a530-11e7-82b4-32c71d03c266.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "File storage read URI generation" (#4775) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Need a URI to an uploaded package for the validation orchestrator to know how to obtain the file to validate.
This change implements SAS-enabled URI generation for the cloud storage, the local file storage leaves it not implemented.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update the delete UI wrt Validating and FailedValidation states" (#4648) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Deleting a Validating or FailedValidation package deletes from the "validating" nupkg container instead of "packages" container.

Search box on admin UI should search all states (including Validating and FailingValidation).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Backup package in validation package container during delete flow (and other little fixes)" (#4774) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
... and some little polishes that are low hanging fruit.

Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3856, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4230, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4648, and https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4683.

Many results:
![screencapture-localhost-admin-delete-1506629861853](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/30988541-754c0dfe-a44f-11e7-80e6-5ca74d848d74.png)

No results:
![screencapture-localhost-admin-delete-1506629851995](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/30988536-71e16ca4-a44f-11e7-9c6e-8faca22dcd65.png)

_...this time without secrets..._
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/30992237-b3226606-a45d-11e7-9504-d47932f11f26.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Delete Packages search UI does not show any message for empty search results" (#4230) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
stemming from https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4229

If the admin delete search does not have any matches, there is no message displayed indicating it and as a user, it seems like I am just pressing a dead button.

I dont think this affects external customers.

Events.RelatedBody: The current dependency is prerelease and unsigned. The API surface area and implementation has not changed at all.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet new mvc fails to restore" (#5973) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @cdmihai on September 30, 2017 0:33_

## Steps to reproduce
dotnet new mvc
dotnet restore

## Expected  behavior
Restore succeeds.

## Actual behavior
```
E:\delete\test>dotnet restore
  Restoring packages for E:\delete\test\test.csproj...
  Restoring packages for E:\delete\test\test.csproj...
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102: Unable to find package Microsoft.AspNetCore.All with version (>= 2.1.0-preview1-26751)
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 4 version(s) in nuget.org [ Nearest version: 2.0.0 ]
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in Package source
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102: Unable to find package Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.CodeGeneration.Tools with version (>= 2.1.0-preview1-26751)
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 15 version(s) in nuget.org [ Nearest version: 2.0.0 ]
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 4 version(s) in Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages [ Nearest version: 1.1.0-preview4-final ]
E:\delete\test\test.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in Package source
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.0-preview1-007228\NuGet.targets(102,5): error : Value cannot be null. [E:\delete\test\test.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.0-preview1-007228\NuGet.targets(102,5): error : Parameter name: path [E:\delete\test\test.csproj]
```

## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

```
.NET Command Line Tools (2.1.0-preview1-007228)

Product Information:
 Version:            2.1.0-preview1-007228
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  28a1f7e9d6

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.15063
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.0-preview1-007228\

Microsoft .NET Core Shared Framework Host

  Version  : 2.1.0-preview1-25719-04
  Build    : b5c917c0b24171ae27c7cfcfd2617b1088d41c11
```






_Copied from original issue: dotnet/cli#7736_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget.exe push returns a 400/BadRequest" (#5972) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
From a Support Request - 

Using command line to push nuget package. Used to work a month ago. Today not working at all: 
`nuget push C:\projects\search\Ingeniux_InSite_Search_2.2.9.2-prerelease.nupkg [api key] -Source https://www.nuget.org `

Getting following response: 
```
Pushing PACKAGE_NAME-prerelease.nupkg to the NuGet gallery (https://www.nuget.org)... 
PUT https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 
BadRequest https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 2485ms 
nuget : Response status code does not indicate success: 400 (Bad Request). At line:1 char:1 + nuget push C:\downloads\Ingeniux_InSite_Search_2.2.9.2-prerelease.nup ... + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (Response status... (Bad Request).:String) [], RemoteException + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NativeCommandError 
```

I have tried to generate a new API key and not making any difference. Because the tool doesn't provide any details of the response text, I cannot figure what is going on. Note: The package is indeed a new pre-release version. I am on a tight deadline to deliver. Your earliest help is greatly appreciated.


--------

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Update PM UI to let user know a signed package is not valid" (#5969) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: When a signed package that has been tampered is being installed, nuget should fail to install and the user should be notified. This task tracks the work for the user experience updates in that flow.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Markdown based documentation for packages" (#9) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Announcing support for rich markdown based documentation for packages

This feature has following parts:
**1. Ability to associate a markdown documentation to packages (and existing packages)
2. Understand markdown and render it properly on NuGet.org package details page**
3. Ability to associate markdown documentation content while packing the package, from clients
4. Ability on VS client to show this markdown content.

1 and 2 have been implemented as part of 2017 Interns project and released now. Please provide your feedback on the feature - both implemented and pending parts.

| Spec wiki| Discussion issue| 
| :------------- |:-------------| 
|https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Package-README.md-support|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/2280|

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Updates to the NuGet.org Terms of Use" (#8) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Today, we’re updating the NuGet.org Terms of Use and Privacy Statement. As we [announced](https://blog.nuget.org/20170907/Changes-to-NuGet-dot-org-service-management-and-performance-improvements-in-China.html) two weeks ago, the NuGet.org service is now a part of Microsoft. The NuGet open source codebase (both the NuGet gallery and the NuGet client) will remain open source and continue as .NET Foundation supported projects under the same terms as before.

We encourage you to read the full [Terms of Use](https://www.nuget.org/policies/Terms) and [Privacy Statement](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839), as well as the [blog post](https://blog.nuget.org/20170907/Changes-to-NuGet-dot-org-service-management-and-performance-improvements-in-China.html) about the changes. For your convenience, below is a quick summary.

There are no changes to the way you publish and consume packages from NuGet.org. The Terms of Use and Privacy Statement have been updated to reflect the change in ownership, as well as how Microsoft will process the data collected, and manage copyright and trademark infringement notices.

Our goal is to provide an agile and reliable global service, and we remain fully committed to ensuring a healthy and open ecosystem around NuGet. The .NET Foundation and Microsoft want NuGet to meet the evolving needs of our community. For questions about our policies, please contact us by email at [feedback@nuget.org](mailto:feedback@nuget.org?subject=Regarding%20updates%20to%20the%20NuGet.org%20Terms%20of%20Use).
